name: Road to Ballhalla
description: Roll and be trolled on your journey to the legendary place called Ballhalla. Follow the beat to overcome deadly hazards in sync with the music. Style your balls and marble at awful puns in the roll playing game of the year!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1/10 64bit Processor: Dual-Core Intel or AMD processor Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 550 GTX / AMD Radeon 5770 HD series card Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Who cares? Additional Notes: Needs a 64bit OS

reviews.review_text: Lighthearted, silly, a bit on the unfortunately short side - unfortunate because it's actually a lot of fun and could have done with more stages... but that's what an in-built level editor and steam workshop is for, I suppose 8D

This game is a marble platformer where you try to guide a marble ehrough a series of obstacles, similar to   Marble Madness  . Every level is unique and brings a new qwirk to play on, from deathballs that follow you around to cameras constantly changing direction. The game also has a great sense of humor, and the text that guides you through the levels is never not funny. The controls are tight and never feel like a burden. Overall you should at least play the game once, it is highly recommended.

A very funny and creative game. I genuinely laughed out loud at multiple jokes in the game, even if it was just text. I reccommend not watching any gameplay as it will give away some of the jokes and surprises. If you like puzzels and whitey/sarcastic humor this is a game for you.  P.S If you try to 100% this game you will lose your sanity due to the challenge...just a quick warning

Road to Ballhalla is a game about great music, simply clean graphics and tricky puzzles that ooze personality making it stand above the rest of the indie game trash. As always you have to dig through a lot of garbage to find gold and this one certainly is. Can't recommend it enough.
Competent in what it does - worth the time if you are into these sort of games and can get it discounted. You can play similar titles for free on the web though.

Frustratingly tough but very well designed game.

I got this game from a Humble Bundle and was positively surprised by it. The design is simple, but slick and every level introduces new elements or uses the traps and obstacles in a different way.  If you don't care about completion or speedrunning, the main campaign isn't that long, but there is an level editor included. The soundtrack is fitting and at least some of the jokes were quite funny.  If you are likely to be only interested in the main campaign, I would recommend waiting for a discount though.
